words.definition: An adhesive is a substance used for sticking things together.
words.example: The carpenter used an adhesive to hold the two pieces of wood together.

words.definition: If something is adverse, then it is harmful.
words.example: Not eating healthy foods can have an adverse effect on your health.

words.definition: A dependency is a strong need for someone or something.
words.example: The child still has a dependency on her mother.

words.definition: To dump something means to throw it away or get rid of it.
words.example: She dumped the garbage into the trash can.

words.definition: If something is eternal, then it lasts forever.
words.example: She said that her love for him was eternal.

words.definition: To fluctuate means to rise and fall in number or amount.
words.example: Prices for gasoline have been fluctuating all month.

words.definition: If something moves to and fro, it moves backward and forward.
words.example: The branch moved to and fro in the wind.

words.definition: Inclusion is the act of including someone or something in a group.
words.example: The inclusion of her name on the list made her happy.

words.definition: If something is intermediate, it is in the middle of two levels.
words.example: She is in an intermediate English class this year.

words.definition: If something is intermittent, it happens sometimes but not regularly.
words.example: The rain was intermittent throughout the afternoon.

words.definition: A mentor is a person who gives advice and help to someone.
words.example: The experienced lawyer acted as a mentor to the new student.

words.definition: A phoenix is a magical bird that dies and is born again from ashes.
words.example: The story tells of a phoenix that lived for five hundred years.

words.definition: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants use sunlight to make food.
words.example: Sunlight is essential for the process of photosynthesis.

words.definition: Pollen is a fine powder produced by flowers.
words.example: Bees carry pollen from one flower to another.

words.definition: To regain something means to get it back again.
words.example: He regained his health after a long rest.

words.definition: To reverse something means to change it to the opposite way.
words.example: He reversed the car out of the garage.

words.definition: A swarm is a large group of insects moving together.
words.example: A swarm of bees was flying around the hive.

words.definition: Texture is the way that something feels when you touch it.
words.example: The fabric has a soft and smooth texture.

words.definition: To tickle someone means to touch them in a way that makes them laugh.
words.example: The father tickled his daughter's feet.

words.definition: If something is vibrant, it is full of energy and color.
words.example: The city has a vibrant and exciting nightlife.
